SourceString: A simple off-road gravbike capable of quickly carrying a prospector across the surface of Fortuna III.

Here you can change how you're represented in the match.
This serves as the base character from which you can build on with further vanity options.

Please note that these vanity options have no gameplay effect and are purely cosmetic.
Comment: "Here is a temp description \n for archetype selection"

SourceString: Choose which banner you want to have represent you, and plant it on the ground in-match with [{BannerKey}] to symbolize your claim.
Choose which Foam Pose to use when defeated in battle.\n\nSelect an Emote Move to taunt your enemies or just goof around by pressing [{EmoteKey}] during the match.
Choose which ride style suits you best. \n\nPlease note that these options are visual only and do not affect your ride's behavior or performance.
Choose a style for your drop pod, visible in the launch bay and your landing location. \n\nPlease note that these changes are visual only and have no gameplay effect.
Choose which spray you want to use, and paint it on surfaces with [{BannerKey}] to let everyone see.
Choose a style for your pet. \n\nPlease note that these changes are visual only and have no gameplay effect.
Waiting for teammates to finish the match

RETURNING TO STATION...
<BH2>GEAR</> AND <BH2>ACQUIRED LOOT</> WILL <BH2>NOT</> CARRY OVER.
DYING WITHIN THIS SIMULATION WILL NOT RESULT IN THE LOSS OF ANY OF YOUR GEAR.

Comment: A small box that keeps organic matter cool

SourceString:
Aurum can be used to purchase the Premium Fortuna Pass and cosmetics, as well as pay for Gear Salvage attempts and build timer skips.

Aurum is gained by upgrading your Quarters, through the Fortuna Pass, or purchased in the Store.

Aurum balance is not affected by season wipes.

K-Marks are the main currency on Fortuna Station, used to purchase all sorts of gear, Standard Insurance, build timer skips, and other services.

K-Marks are earned by working for the factions, selling items looted from the surface, and upgrading your Quarters.

Insurance Tokens pay for an item's Gear Salvage attempt, replacing its Aurum cost.

Insurance Tokens are primarily gained by progressing in the Fortuna Pass
